TEXT: The applicants , PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals and live in PERSON . They are represented before the ORG by PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , lawyers practising in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On CARDINAL DATE PERSON , the first applicant ’s husband and the brother of PERSON and PERSON , was taken into custody by gendarme officers .

Until DATE the applicants all lived in GPE , a village of the GPE district in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE security forces forcibly evacuated the GPE and destroyed the applicants’ property . The applicants then moved to ORG where they currently live .

On DATE the mayors of some villages of the NORP district , including the mayor of GPE , PERSON , petitioned the Governor ’s office in GPE , ORG , the Governor ’s office in the state of emergency region , FAC ) Presidency , the Prime Minister ’s office and the Presidency of the ORG on behalf of the inhabitants of the GPE villages . They requested the aforementioned authorities to allow the inhabitants to return to their villages . They also requested aid for food and compensation for the damage they had suffered .

They received no response to their petitions .
On unspecified dates , the applicants lodged further petitions with the District Governor ’s office in GPE requesting permission to return to their village .

“ Your petition containing a request of permission to return to your village has been received by the District Governor ’s office and will be considered under the ‘ Return to the Village and Rehabilitation Project’ . ”
PERSON disappeared for an unknown reason around DATE .

On DATE PERSON applied to ORG office and claimed that his brother had been taken away by soldiers who had been carrying out operations in the vicinity of their village . He stated that they could not obtain any information from the military authorities about the whereabouts of his brother and that they were worried about his life . He therefore asked for an investigation to be carried out into the disappearance of his brother .

On DATE PERSON filed a petition with ORG office complaining that his brother PERSON and his son PERSON had been taken away DATE in the course of an operation carried out by the security forces . He therefore asked for an investigation to be conducted in order to find out the whereabouts of his relatives .

On DATE PERSON body was found in the vicinity of the neighbouring village . A post - mortem examination was carried out on the body of the deceased under the supervision of the NORP Public prosecutor and in the presence of PERSON .

On DATE Ali PERSON was questioned by Public Prosecutor no . CARDINAL in relation to the death of his brother . PERSON alleged that his brother had been found dead in a field in PERSON village subsequent to his removal from his village by the security forces . He asked ORG to bring those responsible for the death of his brother to justice .

On DATE prosecuting authorities took statements from ORG and PERSON who are respectively the son and wife of the deceased . PERSON stated that security forces conducting operations in GPE had taken him with them to a hamlet attached to his village . In the hamlet he had met PERSON who was the then muhtar ( mayor ) of PERSON village . The soldiers had brought his father , PERSON Yıldız , to the hamlet an hour after their arrival . PERSON had then been separated from his father and the muhtar and had been released in GPE . DATE after this incident his father and the muhtar had been found dead in GPE .

PERSON stated that her husband and son had been taken away by soldiers on DATE and that while her son had been released DATE , her husband had been found dead along with ORG in GPE . She claimed that her husband and PERSON had been killed by the soldiers .

On DATE prosecuting authorities heard evidence from PERSON . PERSON , who was the muhtar of GPE village at the relevant time , stated that he had seen PERSON been taken away by soldiers . He had then inquired into the reason for detention of PERSON at FAC and had been told by the authorities that he would guide the soldiers coming from outside the region . However , the corpses of PERSON and PERSON had been found by PERSON .
Meanwhile , prosecuting authorities took statements from PERSON who is the father of PERSON . He alleged that his son and PERSON had been taken away and killed by soldiers .

On DATE ORG authorities took statements from PERSON , the father of PERSON whose corpse was found together with PERSON . PERSON stated that he did not know the killer(s ) of his son and described the area where he found the bodies of the deceased persons .
On DATE ORG issued a decision of nonjurisdiction ratione loci and sent the investigation file to ORG office .
On DATE ORG issued a decision of nonjurisdiction ratione materiae and sent the case - file to ORG office at ORG ( Elazığ CARDINAL . ORG ) .

On DATE Public Prosecutor no . CARDINAL attached to the ORG office took statements from ORG . The latter stated that his son PERSON , who was the muhtar of GPE village , had been taken away by the soldiers . When he inquired into the arrest of his son , the authorities at FAC had told him that there was an investigation in relation to his son . On DATE PERSON found the bodies of his son and PERSON QUANTITY away from FAC . Efo Kavut asked ORG to initiate criminal proceedings against the soldiers that were responsible for the killing of his son .

On DATE Public Prosecutor no . CARDINAL took statements from PERSON , who worked as a non - commissioned officer at ORG DATE , in relation to the killing of PERSON . Mr PERSON stated that neither PERSON nor PERSON had been detained by their gendarmerie troops . However , he noted that these CARDINAL persons had accompanied a troop as guides in the course of their operations in the region . He did not know the name or commanding officer of the troop in question . He further claimed that he had had no information concerning the death of these QUANTITY persons .

On DATE Public Prosecutor no . DATE questioned Abdulvahip Sarı , who worked as an officer at ORG at the relevant time . Mr PERSON stated that PERSON and PERSON had not been detained at ORG . He had no information concerning the arrest and detention of these persons or the troops operating in the region .
On DATE ORG attached to ORG issued a decision of non - jurisdiction ratione loci and sent the investigation file to ORG office at the ORG of ORG .

In a letter of DATE the Deputy Military Prosecutor at the ORG of ORG asked ORG to report the names of the troops which had conducted operations in the region at the relevant time . He also requested that the names of persons , if any , who had assisted the troops as guides be reported to him . He further asked whether any complaint had been lodged concerning the killing of the persons and , if so , whether any investigation had been carried out into such allegations .

On DATE Military Public Prosecutor in ORG took statements from ORG in relation to the death of his son and PERSON . Mr ORG reiterated his allegations that his son could have been killed by the soldiers who had conducted operations in the region .

On DATE the Military Public prosecutor also took statements from PERSON , the wife of PERSON . She alleged that her husband had been taken away by soldiers and that therefore he must have been killed by them . She however stated that she did not know the names or ranks of the soldiers .

Finally , on DATE , ORG attached to ORG in GPE issued a decision of nonjurisdiction ratione materiae considering that the offence in question fell within the jurisdiction of the state security courts which were competent in terrorist or organised crimes . ORG noted that , despite the allegations that PERSON could have been taken away or killed by the security forces conducting operations in the region , there was no eye - witness and that the overall evidence given by the witnesses consisted of hearsay . He therefore considered that it was impossible to hold the security forces responsible for the killing of PERSON on the basis of hearsay evidence . In light of the evidence contained in the investigation file , ORG concluded that PERSON had been killed by members of the terrorist organisations . A copy of the investigation file was then sent to the Chief Public ORG offices at the ORG and ORG .
In a report dated DATE ORG stated that the investigation into the death of PERSON was still pending in order to identify the culprits .

The official records indicated that the inhabitants of the villages of GPE had evacuated their places of living on account of intense terrorist activities in the region and threats issued by the ORG ( Workers’ ORG ) terrorist organisation against the villagers . The security forces had not destroyed any property or forced the applicants to leave their village . Furthermore , the applicants had not filed any complaint with the authorities concerning the alleged destruction of their property and their forced eviction from ORG . Thus no investigation had been carried out into these allegations which had only been submitted to ORG .

Currently there was no obstacle preventing villagers from returning to their homes and possessions in their villages . Persons who had left their villages as a result of terrorism had already started returning and renewing their activities in their villages .

On DATE the Law on Compensation for Losses resulting from Terrorism and the Fight against Terrorism was passed by ORG and entered into force on DATE ( “ Compensation Law ” ) . That PERSON provided for a sufficient remedy capable of redressing the LAW grievances of persons who were denied access to their possessions in their villages .

In that connection Damage Assessment and Compensation Commissions were set up in QUANTITY provinces . Persons who had suffered damage as a result of terrorism or of measures taken by the authorities to combat terrorism could lodge an application with the relevant compensation commission claiming compensation .

The number of persons applying to these commissions had already attained CARDINAL . CARDINAL persons , whose applications were pending before the ORG , had also applied to the compensation commissions . Many villagers had already been awarded compensation for the damage they had sustained .
